Eastgate Mall Parking Lot, 2017

// TIMESTAMP: 09.14.2017 ‚Äî 11:47 PM

They demolished the Eastgate Mall arcade on a Tuesday. I sat in the parking lot and cried like something had actually died, because something had. Not the building ‚Äî the version of me that believed fluorescent light and carpet smell and the sound of quarters dropping would last forever.

My cousin Null found me there. He said, "What if we could freeze a feeling in resin?" and I said, "What if we could freeze everything in resin."

That was the night VaporwaveTaxidermy was born. We started with a roadkill raccoon and a gallon of epoxy from the hardware store. The raccoon looked terrible. The feeling looked perfect.

Now we take animals that are already gone ‚Äî ethically sourced, naturally deceased, surrendered by owners who loved them ‚Äî and we suspend them in swirling iridescent resin that looks like the inside of a screensaver from 1997. Every piece is a tiny monument to something that was alive once. The animal. The mall. The future we were promised that never showed up.

Mr. Whiskers came to us in a shoebox with a handwritten note that said "please make him beautiful again." He had been taxidermied in 1998 by someone who clearly learned from YouTube before YouTube existed. Now he's suspended in cyan-shifting resin, gazing into a middle distance that no longer contains suffering.
